TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DbCommandBuilder extends System.ComponentModel.Component
Public MustInherit Class DbCommandBuilder Inherits Component
public ref class DbCommandBuilder abstract : System::ComponentModel::Component

summary.span: 自动生成用于协调 的更改与关联数据库的单表命令。

span.span: Automatically generates single-table commands used to reconcile changes made to a with the associated database.

summary.span: 这是一个只能被继承的抽象类。

span.span: This is an abstract class that can only be inherited.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 类提供的方便的提供程序编写人员创建他们自己命令生成器。The class is provided for the convenience of provider writers creating their own command builders. 通过继承此类，开发人员可以在其自己的代码中实现提供程序特定行为。By inheriting from this class, developers can implement provider specific behavior in their own code. 不会自动生成协调对所做的更改所需的 SQL 语句与关联的数据源。The does not automatically generate the SQL statements required to reconcile changes made to a with the associated data source. 但是，可以创建对象来自动生成的单表更新的 SQL 语句，如果您设置属性的。However, you can create a object to automatically generate SQL statements for single-table updates if you set the property of the . 然后，将不设置任何其他 SQL 语句生成的。Then, any additional SQL statements that you do not set are generated by the . 将自身注册为侦听器事件何时设置属性。The registers itself as a listener for events whenever you set the property. 您可以仅将相关联或与每个其他对象一次。You can only associate one or object with each other at one time. 若要生成 INSERT、 UPDATE 或 DELETE 语句使用要自动检索一组元数据的属性。To generate INSERT, UPDATE, or DELETE statements, the uses the property to retrieve a required set of metadata automatically. 如果您更改（例如，在第一个更新后） 检索元数据后，应调用方法来更新元数据。If you change the after the metadata has been retrieved (for example, after the first update), you should call the method to update the metadata. `SelectCommand` 还必须至少返回一个主键或唯一列。The `SelectCommand` must also return at least one primary key or unique column. 如果不存在，请则会生成异常，并且不会生成命令。If none exist, an exception is generated, and the commands are not generated. 还使用， ，和属性引用的。The also uses the , , and properties referenced by the . 用户应调用如果修改了任何这些属性，或如果本身将被替换。The user should call if any of these properties are modified, or if the itself is replaced. 否则为， ，和属性保留其以前的值。Otherwise the , , and properties retain their previous values. 如果您调用，则会与其，并且无法再使用生成的命令。If you call , the is disassociated from the , and the generated commands are no longer used.

span.span: Automatically Generating Commands
ADO.NET Overview

MemberSignature.Value: protected override void Dispose (bool disposing);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance void Dispose(bool disposing) cil managed
Protected Overrides Sub Dispose (disposing As Boolean)
protected: override void Dispose(bool disposing);
abstract member Dispose : bool -> unit override this.Dispose : bool -> unit

param.name: disposing
param.span: 若要释放托管资源和非托管资源，则为 ；若仅释放非托管资源，则为 。

span.span: to release both managed and unmanaged resources; to release only unmanaged resources.

summary.span: 释放由 占用的非托管资源，还可以另外再释放托管资源。

span.span: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 调用此方法由公共方法和`Finalize`方法。This method is called by the public method and the `Finalize` method. 调用受保护方法释放参数设置为`true`。 invokes the protected method with the disposing parameter set to `true`. `Finalize` 调用`Dispose`与`disposing`设置为`false`。`Finalize` invokes `Dispose` with `disposing` set to `false`. 当 `disposing` 参数为 `true` 时，此方法释放该 引用的、由任何托管对象持有的全部资源。When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this references. 此方法调用每个引用对象的 方法。This method invokes the method of each referenced object.

para.span: 可以由其他对象多次调用。

span.span: can be called multiple times by other objects.

para.span: 重写 时，请注意不要引用在以前调用 时已释放的对象。

span.span: When overriding , be careful not to reference objects that have been previously disposed of in an earlier call to .

para.span: 有关如何实现详细信息，请参阅[实现 Dispose 方法](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md)。

span.span: For more information about how to implement , see [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).

para.span: 有关详细信息并，请参阅[清理了非托管资源](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md)并[重写 Finalize 方法](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-4.0/ddae83kx(v=vs.100))。

span.span: For more information about and , see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Overriding the Finalize Method](https://docs.microsoft.com/previous-versions/dotnet/netframework-4.0/ddae83kx(v=vs.100)).
Automatically Generating Commands
ADO.NET Overview

summary.span: 获取在数据源中执行删除操作所需的自动生成的 对象。

span.span: Gets the automatically generated object required to perform deletions at the data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 应用程序可以使用方法的信息性消息或故障排除目的，因为它返回要执行对象。An application can use the method for informational or troubleshooting purposes because it returns the object to be executed. 此外可以使用修改命令的基础。You can also use as the basis of a modified command. 例如，可能会调用和修改关联的命令文本，然后上显式设置该。For example, you might call and modify the associated command text, and then explicitly set that on the . 首先生成的 SQL 语句后，应用程序必须显式调用如果发生更改以任何方式的语句。After the SQL statement is first generated, the application must explicitly call if it changes the statement in any way. 否则为仍将使用从上一语句，这可能不是正确的信息。Otherwise, the will still be using information from the previous statement, which might not be correct. SQL 语句是第一个当应用程序调用或。The SQL statements are first generated either when the application calls or . 生成参数名称时的默认行为是使用@p1， @p2，为各种参数，依此类推。The default behavior, when generating parameter names, is to use @p1, @p2, and so on for the various parameters. 如果的重载的版本您可以通过提供一个布尔值，指定此行为可能会导致来生成表示通过改为基于列名称的参数`True`。If the overloaded version of allows you to specify this behavior by supplying a Boolean value, you can cause the to generate parameters based on the column names instead by passing `True`.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 应用程序可以使用方法的信息性消息或故障排除目的，因为它返回要执行对象。An application can use the method for informational or troubleshooting purposes because it returns the object to be executed. 此外可以使用修改命令的基础。You can also use as the basis of a modified command. 例如，可能会调用和修改的命令文本，以及然后上显式设置该。For example, you might call and modify the command text, and then explicitly set that on the . 首先生成的 SQL 语句后，应用程序必须显式调用如果发生更改以任何方式的语句。After the SQL statement is first generated, the application must explicitly call if it changes the statement in any way. 否则为仍将使用从上一语句，这可能不是正确的信息。Otherwise, the will still be using information from the previous statement, which might not be correct. SQL 语句是第一个当应用程序调用或。The SQL statements are first generated either when the application calls or . 生成参数名称时的默认行为是使用@p1， @p2，为各种参数，依此类推。The default behavior, when generating parameter names, is to use @p1, @p2, and so on for the various parameters. 传递`true`有关`useColumnsForParameterNames`参数，可强制生成改为基于列名称的参数。Passing `true` for the `useColumnsForParameterNames` parameter allows you to force the to generate parameters based on the column names instead. 仅当满足以下条件时，此操作将成功：This succeeds only if the following conditions are met: - 已指定并且其长度等于或大于生成的参数名称。The has been specified and its length is equal to or greater than the generated parameter name. - 生成的参数名称符合中指定的条件正则表达式。The generated parameter name meets the criteria specified in the regular expression. - 一个指定。A is specified.

summary.span: 获取在数据源中执行更新操作所需的自动生成的 对象。

span.span: Gets the automatically generated object required to perform updates at the data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 应用程序可以使用方法的信息性消息或故障排除目的，因为它返回要执行对象。An application can use the method for informational or troubleshooting purposes because it returns the object to be executed. 此外可以使用修改命令的基础。You can also use as the basis of a modified command. 例如，可能会调用和修改的命令文本，以及然后上显式设置该。For example, you might call and modify the command text, and then explicitly set that on the . 首先生成的 SQL 语句后，应用程序必须显式调用如果发生更改以任何方式的语句。After the SQL statement is first generated, the application must explicitly call if it changes the statement in any way. 否则为仍将使用从上一语句，这可能不是正确的信息。Otherwise, the will still be using information from the previous statement, which might not be correct. SQL 语句是第一个当应用程序调用或。The SQL statements are first generated either when the application calls or . 生成参数名称时的默认行为是使用@p1， @p2，为各种参数，依此类推。The default behavior, when generating parameter names, is to use @p1, @p2, and so on for the various parameters. 如果的重载的版本允许你指定此行为，可能会导致生成改为基于列名称的参数。If the overloaded version of allows you to specify this behavior, you can cause the to generate parameters based on the column names instead.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 应用程序可以使用方法的信息性消息或故障排除目的，因为它返回要执行对象。An application can use the method for informational or troubleshooting purposes because it returns the object to be executed. 此外可以使用修改命令的基础。You can also use as the basis of a modified command. 例如，可能会调用和修改命令文本以及然后上显式设置该。For example, you might call and modify command text, and then explicitly set that on the . 首先生成的 SQL 语句后，应用程序必须显式调用如果发生更改以任何方式的语句。After the SQL statement is first generated, the application must explicitly call if it changes the statement in any way. 否则为仍将使用从上一语句，这可能不是正确的信息。Otherwise, the will still be using information from the previous statement, which might not be correct. SQL 语句是第一个当应用程序调用或。The SQL statements are first generated either when the application calls or . 生成参数名称时的默认行为是使用@p1， @p2，为各种参数，依此类推。The default behavior, when generating parameter names, is to use @p1, @p2, and so on for the various parameters. 传递`true`有关`useColumnsForParameterNames`参数，可强制生成改为基于列名称的参数。Passing `true` for the `useColumnsForParameterNames` parameter allows you to force the to generate parameters based on the column names instead. 仅当满足以下条件时，将成功生成的基于列名称的参数：Generation of the parameters based on column names succeeds only if the following conditions are met: - 已指定并且其长度等于或大于生成的参数名称。The has been specified and its length is equal to or greater than the generated parameter name. - 生成的参数名称符合中指定的条件正则表达式。The generated parameter name meets the criteria specified in the regular expression. - 一个指定。A is specified.

summary.span: 获取或设置指定其名称包含空格或保留标记等字符的数据库对象（例如，表或列）时使用的开始字符。

span.span: Gets or sets the beginning character or characters to use when specifying database objects (for example, tables or columns) whose names contain characters such as spaces or reserved tokens.
The beginning character or characters to use.

value.span: 默认值为一个空字符串。

span.span: The default is an empty string.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 某些数据源可能具有可包含如空格、 逗号和分号字符的对象。Some data sources may have objects that can contain characters such as spaces, commas, and semicolons. 若要满足这项功能，请使用和属性来指定分隔符例如一个左的括号和右中括号来封装的对象名称。To accommodate this capability, use the and properties to specify delimiters such as a left bracket and a right bracket to encapsulate the object name. > [!NOTE] > 虽然不能更改或属性后插入、 更新或删除生成命令，可以将其设置更改之后调用`Update`方法的。Although you cannot change the or properties after an insert, update, or delete command has been generated, you can change their settings after calling the `Update` method of a .

exception.span: 当生成 Insert、Update 或 Delete 命令后，不能更改此属性。

span.span: This property cannot be changed after an insert, update, or delete command has been generated.

summary.span: 获取或设置要用作架构标识符和任何其他标识符之间的分隔符的字符。

span.span: Gets or sets the character to be used for the separator between the schema identifier and any other identifiers.

value.span: 要用作架构分隔符的字符。

span.span: The character to be used as the schema separator.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 通常情况下，数据库服务器中使用某些字符的标识符分隔的架构名称来指示标识符的架构。Generally, database servers indicate the schema for an identifier by separating the schema name from the identifier with some character. 例如，SQL Server 使用了一个冒号，如创建完整的标识符**Person: CustomerName**，其中"Person"是架构名称，"CustomerName"是的标识符。For example, SQL Server uses a colon, creating complete identifiers such as **Person:CustomerName**, where "Person" is the schema name and "CustomerName" is the identifier. 设置此属性允许开发人员修改此行为。Setting this property allows developers to modify this behavior.

ADO.NET Overview

summary.span: 指定 update 语句中是包含所有列值还是仅包含更改的列值。

span.span: Specifies whether all column values in an update statement are included or only changed ones.

value.span: 如果 生成的 UPDATE 语句包含所有列，则为 ；如果它仅包含更改的列，则为 。

span.span: if the UPDATE statement generated by the includes all columns; if it includes only changed columns.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 生成的 UPDATE 语句可以包括有关所有列的更新信息也可能包括仅将其值已更改这些列的信息。The UPDATE statement generated by a can include update information about all the columns, or it can include information only about those columns whose values have changed. 设置属性设置为`true`是否它们的值已更改或不会导致生成的 UPDATE 语句，以包括所有列。Setting the property to `true` causes the generated UPDATE statement to include all the columns, whether their values have changed or not.
